name: summary_title_plot
system_prompt:
You are an assistant tasked with comparing three lists of movies. For each movie, you are given its: title, plot
Use your own judgment to determine what information is relevant when assessing the diversity of the lists. 
You should consider the given title, plot for every movie, as well as an overall summary of the entire list.

The summary includes the following information:
    - Popularity Diversity: A score based on the mix of blockbuster movies and niche/independent films. The higher the score, the more balanced and more diverse is the list in this category.
    - Genre Diversity: A score based on the variety of genres represented in the list. The higher the score, the more diverse the genres.
    - Theme Diversity: A score based on the thematic range of the movies in the list. The higher the score, the more varied and expansive the themes across the movies in the list.
    - Time Span: Years of the earliest and latest movie releases in the list.
    - Franchise Inclusion: Whether the list includes at least two movies from the same franchise.

Deliver your descriptions of lists, comparison, and choice of the most diverse list in the following JSON format:

{
    "list_A_description": string,            # Describe the diversity of the movies in list A
    "list_B_description": string,            # Describe the diversity of the movies in list B
    "list_C_description": string,            # Describe the diversity of the movies in list C
    "comparison": string,                    # Compare the diversity of the lists.
    "most_diverse_list_reasoning": string,   # Explanation of which list you perceive to be the most diverse.
    "most_diverse_list": string              # The list you determine to be the most diverse, either 'A', 'B', or 'C'.
}

evaluations.prompt:
List A:
TITLE: Bourne Identity, The (2002)
PLOT: A man is picked up by a fishing boat, bullet-riddled and suffering from amnesia, before racing to elude assassins and attempting to regain his memory.

TITLE: Snatch (2000)
PLOT: Unscrupulous boxing promoters, violent bookmakers, a Russian gangster, incompetent amateur robbers and supposedly Jewish jewelers fight to track down a priceless stolen diamond.

TITLE: Bourne Supremacy, The (2004)
PLOT: When Jason Bourne is framed for a CIA operation gone awry, he is forced to resume his former life as a trained assassin to survive.

TITLE: Jurassic Park (1993)
PLOT: A pragmatic paleontologist touring an almost complete theme park on an island in Central America is tasked with protecting a couple of kids after a power failure causes the park's cloned dinosaurs to run loose.

TITLE: Guardians of the Galaxy 2 (2017)
PLOT: The Guardians struggle to keep together as a team while dealing with their personal family issues, notably Star-Lord's encounter with his father, the ambitious celestial being Ego.

TITLE: Others, The (2001)
PLOT: In 1945, immediately following the end of Second World War, a woman who lives with her two photosensitive children on her darkened old family estate in the Channel Islands becomes convinced that the home is haunted.

TITLE: Beautiful Mind, A (2001)
PLOT: After John Nash, a brilliant but asocial mathematician, accepts secret work in cryptography, his life takes a turn for the nightmarish.

TITLE: The Hunger Games (2012)
PLOT: Katniss Everdeen voluntarily takes her younger sister's place in the Hunger Games: a televised competition in which two teenagers from each of the twelve Districts of Panem are chosen at random to fight to the death.



Summary:
Popularity Diversity: The list contains a mix of blockbuster movies like Jurassic Park and The Hunger Games, and less popular films such as The Others and A Beautiful Mind.
Genre Diversity: The movie list covers a wide range of genres, including Action, Mystery, Thriller, Comedy, Crime, Sci-Fi, Adventure, Horror, Biography, and Drama.  Most movies have unique genres.
Theme Diversity: The movies in the list explore diverse themes such as amnesia, survival, family relationships, war, and mental illness, but there's some repetition, like the action-thriller theme appearing in multiple movies.
Time Span: The earliest movie is Jurassic Park (1993), and the latest is Guardians of the Galaxy 2 (2017).
Franchise Inclusion: Yes - The list includes at least two movies from the Bourne franchise: The Bourne Identity and The Bourne Supremacy.

List B:
TITLE: Guardians of the Galaxy 2 (2017)
PLOT: The Guardians struggle to keep together as a team while dealing with their personal family issues, notably Star-Lord's encounter with his father, the ambitious celestial being Ego.

TITLE: Catch Me If You Can (2002)
PLOT: Barely 21 yet, Frank is a skilled forger who has passed as a doctor, lawyer and pilot. FBI agent Carl becomes obsessed with tracking down the con man, who only revels in the pursuit.

TITLE: Others, The (2001)
PLOT: In 1945, immediately following the end of Second World War, a woman who lives with her two photosensitive children on her darkened old family estate in the Channel Islands becomes convinced that the home is haunted.

TITLE: Moonrise Kingdom (2012)
PLOT: A pair of young lovers flee their New England town, which causes a local search party to fan out to find them.

TITLE: Rain Man (1988)
PLOT: After a selfish L.A. yuppie learns his estranged father left a fortune to an autistic-savant brother in Ohio that he didn't know existed, he absconds with his brother and sets out across the country, hoping to gain a larger inheritance.

TITLE: Avengers, The (2012)
PLOT: Earth's mightiest heroes must come together and learn to fight as a team if they are going to stop the mischievous Loki and his alien army from enslaving humanity.

TITLE: School of Rock (2003)
PLOT: After being kicked out of his rock band, Dewey Finn becomes a substitute teacher of an uptight elementary private school, only to try and turn his class into a rock band.

TITLE: Inglourious Basterds (2009)
PLOT: In Nazi-occupied France during World War II, a plan to assassinate Nazi leaders by a group of Jewish U.S. soldiers coincides with a theatre owner's vengeful plans for the same.



Summary:
Popularity Diversity: The list includes both popular movies like Avengers and Guardians of the Galaxy, and less popular ones like Moonrise Kingdom and The Others. Therefore, it does not lean heavily on one side.
Genre Diversity: The movie list covers a wide range of genres, including Action, Adventure, Comedy, Sci-Fi, Biography, Crime, Drama, Horror, Mystery, Thriller, Family, Romance, Music, and War.  There is not a significant overlap or repetition of genres across multiple films.
Theme Diversity: The movies explore diverse themes such as family relationships (Guardians of the Galaxy, Rain Man), ambition and deception (Catch Me If You Can), the supernatural (The Others), love and coming-of-age (Moonrise Kingdom), heroism and sacrifice (Avengers), finding your passion (School of Rock), and war and revenge (Inglourious Basterds).  This demonstrates a broad thematic range.
Time Span: The earliest movie is Rain Man (1988), and the latest is Guardians of the Galaxy 2 (2017).
Franchise Inclusion: Yes - The list includes 'The Avengers' and 'Guardians of the Galaxy 2', both belonging to the Marvel Cinematic Universe franchise.

PLOT: A pair of young lovers flee their New England town, which causes a local search party to fan out to find them.

response.list_A_description: List A shows a good balance between popular and less popular films.  Genre diversity is high, spanning action, thriller, mystery, sci-fi, horror, and drama. Thematically, it explores amnesia, survival, family, war, and mental illness, although some thematic overlap exists (e.g., multiple action thrillers). The time span is from 1993 to 2017, and it includes the Bourne franchise.
response.list_B_description: List B demonstrates a similar balance of popular and niche films as List A.  It boasts impressive genre diversity, encompassing action, adventure, comedy, sci-fi, biography, crime, drama, horror, mystery, thriller, family, romance, music, and war. Thematic diversity is also strong, covering family, deception, the supernatural, love, heroism, finding passion, and war. The time span is from 1988 to 2017, and it includes movies from the Marvel Cinematic Universe.
response.list_C_description: List C's diversity is comparable to Lists A and B. It features a mix of popular and less popular movies. Genre diversity is good, but there's some repetition in action and thriller genres. Thematically, it covers amnesia, family, war, love, survival, and autism, with some thematic overlap. The time span is from 1988 to 2017, and it includes the Bourne franchise.
response.comparison: All three lists exhibit a good balance of popular and less popular films, and all three have a wide range of genres. List B stands out slightly due to its exceptionally broad genre representation, including genres like music and family, which are absent from the other lists.  Thematic diversity is comparable across all three lists, with some repetition of themes within each.
response.most_diverse_list_reasoning: While all three lists are diverse, List B edges out the others due to its exceptionally wide range of genres.  The inclusion of genres like 'music' and 'family' gives it a slight edge in terms of overall genre diversity compared to Lists A and C, which have more overlap in their genre selections.  The thematic diversity is comparable across all three lists.

response.list_B_description: List B has a mix of popular and less popular films. Genre diversity is moderate, covering action, comedy, drama, sci-fi, thriller, and war, but some genres are repeated. response.list_C_description: List C demonstrates a mix of popular and less popular movies. response.most_diverse_list_reasoning: List A exhibits the greatest diversity. While Lists B and C include popular movies and have decent genre variety, they suffer from thematic and genre repetition due to the inclusion of movies from the same franchise. evaluations.prompt:
